name: 2,6-dichlorobenzaldehyde
Reason: 2,6-dichlorobenzaldehyde has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for this compound is benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5 °C. The introduction of two chlorine atoms increases the molecular weight and electronegativity, which can raise the melting point by approximately +20 °C. The aldehyde group can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds, estimated at around +10 °C. The presence of two chlorine atoms can also increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and electronegativity.
